etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Edward Griffith (1790–1858), naturalist. From classical Latin būbalus bubal + -ine

definitions: Of or relating to a hartebeest or other related antelope; designating such an antelope, especially the bubal, Alcelaphus buselaphus buselaphus.

notes.text: Antelopes of this type were formerly placed in the subfamily Bubalinae and are now placed in the subfamily Alcelaphinae.

definitions: Of, relating to, or resembling a buffalo or other bovid, especially a bovid of the genus Bubalus; designating such a bovid.
